content:
So @Amanjeev Sethi's tweet got me thinking:

https://twitter.com/amanjeev/status/1123545258250375168

I wanted to suggest yesterday that we ought to do a "sprint blog post" to lay out our immediate aims and draw attention. I think this is something all working groups should do, though we don't always manage it =)

Did you know that there is a Learning Working Group in @rustlang compiler team? https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/tree/master/working-groups/learning Goal: This working group aims to make the compiler easier to learn by ensuring that rustc-guide and api docs are "complete". cc/ @nikomatsakis and @spastorino

- Amanjeev Sethi (@amanjeev)

Would that be on https://blog.rust-lang.org/ ?

That's a good question. It's not something we've traditionally used the main blog for, but I think we perhaps underutilize the main blog. I've also debated that the compiler team ought to have a blog.
Or, more accurately, I think we should have some way to call attention to status updates and the like
and this feels like that sort of thing
anyway, I wasn't imaging anything super fancy
I think a post saying "We're creating a new learning wg. It's focus is making rustc better to learn. To start, we're doing x, y, and z" would suffice
Maybe it's time for a dev-blog.rust-lang.org? A blog for the compiler contributors?
I've also wanted to have a place to blog about lang team stuff
FWIW I think posting on blog.rust-lang.org is fine for things other than releases personally; we might not link to it from HN, reddit, internals, users, etc. but it is a good forum
OTOH setting up compiler.blog.rust-lang.org would also be pretty easy
How many posts do we anticipate? If it is not much, maybe using some kind of filtering mechanism might be better and just one blog to find all content?
We've discussed this in #t-compiler/wg-meta a bit -- I think that if working groups are working well, it'd be nice to have a "regular way" to post updates
i'm not sure the main blog is a good fit for this
oh makes sense then to have a separate blog
yeah, it would help a lot, I think, rather than having to follow many individual blogs (e.g. niko's, boats's, aturon's, ...)
